title: How to Make Chocolate Balls

steps.headline: Brew the coffee and let it cool before use.
Add the butter, sugar, rolled oats, cocoa powder, and vanilla powder into the bowl.
Check the coffee to make sure it's not hot, and then pour 2 tablespoons (29.6 ml) of it into the bowl.
Use your hands to knead the bowl's contents into a dough-like mixture.
steps.description: There should not be any clumps of butter when you're done.

steps.headline: Take a piece of the dough and roll it until it turns to a ball.
steps.description: Continue with the rest of the dough and make sure they're the same size. If you like, you may try making different shapes with them!

steps.headline: Roll the balls in coconut powder, confectioners sugar/pearl sugar or oats (or be creative and use something else).
Put the balls in the fridge for a few hours or until they're hard.
steps.description: But that's not necessary if you like them soft and warm. Try them both ways, and pick your favorite!

steps.headline: Eat all you want of your new delicious chocolate balls!

text: Brew the coffee and let it cool before use.  Add the butter, sugar, rolled oats, cocoa powder, and vanilla powder into the bowl.  Check the coffee to make sure it's not hot, and then pour 2 tablespoons (29.6 ml) of it into the bowl.  Use your hands to knead the bowl's contents into a dough-like mixture. There should not be any clumps of butter when you're done. Take a piece of the dough and roll it until it turns to a ball. Continue with the rest of the dough and make sure they're the same size. If you like, you may try making different shapes with them! Roll the balls in coconut powder, confectioners sugar/pearl sugar or oats (or be creative and use something else).  Put the balls in the fridge for a few hours or until they're hard. But that's not necessary if you like them soft and warm. Try them both ways, and pick your favorite! Eat all you want of your new delicious chocolate balls!
